conclusion: The number of turns of a circular coil is N=200, the area of the coil is S=1m^2, the resistance of the coil is r=10Ω, and the coil is connected to an external resistor with a resistance of R=50Ω. The coil is placed in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the coil and directed inward. The variation of the magnetic induction over time is shown in Figure B.
Calculate the total resistance of the circuit as the sum of the internal resistance of the coil and the external resistor, resulting in R_total = 60Ω.
The magnetic induction changes linearly from 0 to 0.4 T in 6 seconds as shown in the graph.
Calculate the rate of change of magnetic induction as 0.0667 T·m^2/s.
Calculate the maximum electromotive force (ε) using Faraday's Law as 13.33 V.
Calculate the maximum current (I) using Ohm's Law as 0.2222 A.
Calculate the maximum power consumed by R using the formula P = I^2 · R, resulting in approximately 2.47 W.
